title: ICE on nightly "assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code
```rust
pub struct Broken {
    _broken: Box<dyn Fn(&()) -> Box<dyn ToString + '_>>,
}

impl From<Broken> for ()
{
    fn from(_: Broken) -> Self {}
}
```

NOTE: I could only reproduce it with the following cargo workspace structure:
https://github.com/FSMaxB/rust-ice-reproducer

### Meta
Interestingly this needs the cargo workspace structure to happen. Just the code isn't enough

```
$ cargo +nightly --version --verbose
cargo 1.61.0-nightly (65c8266 2022-03-09)
release: 1.61.0-nightly
commit-hash: 65c82664263feddc5fe2d424be0993c28d46377a
commit-date: 2022-03-09
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
libgit2: 1.4.1 (sys:0.14.1 vendored)
libcurl: 7.80.0-DEV (sys:0.4.51+curl-7.80.0 vendored ssl:OpenSSL/1.1.1m)
os: Arch Linux Rolling Release [64-bit]
```

```$ ./rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.61.0-nightly (52b34550a 2022-03-15)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 52b34550aca5f7dd7e152f773e3ab786acb86f6f
commit-date: 2022-03-15
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.61.0-nightly
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```
